title: Olive tree
content: It is extensively cultivated in Palestine for the sake of the oil. The olive requires being grafted; hence Paul’s allusion to the Gentiles (
); but what he describes is the reverse of the ordinary gardening operation and is therefore spoken of as “contrary to nature” (
). Using the olive tree in an allegorical sense to illustrate Israel and the Gentiles is also done by Zenos, as quoted by
